result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas N Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, school, or combination of the two or if not complete 15 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
SAFE program.
NO days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas N Thomas
Current: 602 Blaine Street, Merrill, WI 54452 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2015)
Prior: 421 N 2nd Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:12 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Pauline Toulouse.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Restraining Order-Temporary Restraining Order)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; SAFE program; no contact with K.L; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 15 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:20 am
Jury Trial on March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on March 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

No contact with victim(s): K.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
